newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Lippo General Insurance to float shares - paper.
newsitem.headline: Lippo General Insurance to float shares - paper.

text.p: Indonesia's PT Lippo General Insurance (LGI), a subsidiary of the Lippo Group, is expected to offer up to 51 million shares, or a 34 percent stake, to the public, the Indonesian Observer newspaper reported on Thursday.
The newspaper quoted LGI president director M.F. Tumbelaka as saying the insurance company would float its shares on the Jakarta and Surabaya stock exchanges.
Tumbelaka did not give a timetable for the planned floatation or the expected amount the firm planned to raise from the share offering.
"We are optimistic that LGI will book 19.1 billion rupiah in net profit in 1997 and 27 billion rupiah in 1998," Tumbelaka was quoted as saying by the newspaper.
LGI posted a net profit of 5.8 billion rupiah in 1996 against 2.6 billion rupiah in 1995, the newspaper said.
